summary: A segment where professional football players read and react to their negative draft profiles, providing insights into overcoming skepticism and adversity.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape and a prominent building labeled "Merritt Parkway Arena." The show, titled "The Dan Patrick Show," is indicated by a logo on the floor. Three men are seated in the studio, each with a microphone and laptop in front of them. The man on the left, wearing a black jacket and white cap, is holding a piece of paper and gesturing as he speaks. The man in the middle, dressed in a red plaid shirt, is also holding a piece of paper and appears to be listening attentively. The man on the right, wearing a blue shirt and headphones, is looking at his laptop screen. The studio is decorated with sports memorabilia, including helmets and figurines, and the atmosphere is casual and conversational. The men engage in a discussion, with the man on the left frequently gesturing and the man in the middle occasionally responding. The video captures the dynamic interaction among the hosts as they discuss sports-related topics.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker expressing that they have negative draft profiles and clarifying that they did not write them. Then, another male speaker confirms this and states that they want to see the draft profile. Next, the first speaker says "I want to see your draft profile." The second male speaker acknowledges this, and then identifies a person named "Russell Wilson Jr. the third." The second male speaker then makes a statement about someone else doing something. Then there is a sound that sounds like laughter. The male speaker is heard making some kind of a remark, and then makes an exclamatory statement.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a marina view. Two men are engaged in a conversation, with one seated behind a desk adorned with various sports memorabilia, including helmets and figurines, and the other seated on a leather armchair. The man behind the desk, wearing headphones and a black shirt, gestures animatedly while speaking, and the man on the armchair, dressed in a black hoodie and white cap, holds a piece of paper and listens attentively. The background prominently displays a large screen with the NFL logo and a football trophy, along with a sign reading "Mercedes-Benz Stadium." The atmosphere is lively and focused on sports discussion, with both men appearing engaged and enthusiastic about the topic at hand.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker saying "Keeping this shoe," followed by him mentioning someone placing something in their locker to look at it every day. He specifies that this event occurred "two years ago." Another male speaker offers reassurance, saying "Don't worry, I'll have this." The first speaker responds "Okay, all right, here you go." Finally, a thudding sound is briefly heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large desk and a leather chair. Two men are present, one seated behind the desk and the other in the chair. The man behind the desk is wearing a headset and speaking into a microphone, while the man in the chair, dressed in a black hoodie and white cap, holds a piece of paper and speaks into a microphone. The background is adorned with various sports memorabilia, including helmets and footballs, and a large screen displaying the NFL logo and a football stadium. The text on the screen identifies the man in the chair as "RUSSELL WILSON, 3rd Round Pick in 2012 NFL Draft (Wisconsin)." The atmosphere is professional and focused on sports discussion, with the men engaged in conversation and the studio environment emphasizing the theme of American football.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with one man introducing a quote about Russell Wilson. He reads the quote in a formal tone, stating that Wilson's height will be his "biggest inhibitor," and questioning his ability to effectively throw from the pocket. The speaker further notes that Wilson might be rushing the decision-making process. The speaker acknowledges Wilson's arm quality but questions his future potential to be a "prototypical NFL quarterback." Concluding that, he could be a "part-time specialist coming off the bench." Laughter and chatter can be heard after the quote. A second man then speaks in response, asking if the identity of the people who wrote the quote is known.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape and a stadium. Two men are seated, one behind a desk with a microphone and laptop, and the other in a chair holding papers. The desk is adorned with sports memorabilia, including helmets and footballs, and a screen displays 'The Dan Patrick Show Minnesota.' The man in the chair, dressed in a dark sweater and jeans, reads from his papers while the other man, wearing a cap and headphones, listens attentively. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man in the chair, who appears to be speaking into the microphone, with a background featuring a football helmet and a 'LII' football. The video then shows a split-screen image of the man in the chair and a football player in a red jersey with the number 10, preparing to throw a football. The player's jersey reads 'Cotton Bowl' and 'Ole Miss.' The video concludes with a wider shot of the studio, revealing three men seated, with the man in the center holding papers and speaking into the microphone, while the other two listen. The studio is decorated with various sports items, and the atmosphere is professional and focused on sports discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with two male speakers discussing professional athletes. One quotes Drew Brees and Christian McCaffrey, followed by a joke about names and phone numbers. One male speaker reads an assessment about an athleteâ€™s skills, including needing more bulk, not being athletic, deep throws lacking accuracy, and needing to protect the ball better. The reading is interjected with comments about athletic ability and dunking. The first speaker then summarizes, stating that it sounds wonderful and like a first-round draft pick. The clip ends with a discussion about draft profiles, noting the lack of access to information.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a conversation between two men in a studio setting, with a large window in the background showcasing a cityscape and a stadium. The man on the left, dressed in a dark sweater and pants, is seated on a chair, holding a piece of paper and gesturing with his hands as he speaks. The man on the right, wearing a headset and a dark jacket, is seated behind a desk adorned with various sports memorabilia, including helmets and a laptop. The desk prominently displays a screen with the text "The Dan Patrick Show Minnesota," indicating the name of the show and its location. The studio is decorated with sports-related items, such as helmets and a football, contributing to the sports-themed atmosphere. The conversation appears to be engaging, with both men actively participating. The video concludes with a transition to a black screen, signaling the end of the segment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing that certain football players, such as Breeze and Aaron Rogers, took their draft profiles home with them because they wanted to use them. The speaker sounds conversational and casual. Another male voice chimes in with short affirmations. Then, the first male speaker states that they are going to talk about Luke Kuechly, and the audio clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape. The host, dressed in a black jacket with a logo, is seated at a desk with a microphone, holding a piece of paper and engaging in conversation. The desk is adorned with various sports memorabilia, including footballs, helmets, and hats, with a prominent "LII" hat and a "Patriots" cap visible. The text overlay identifies the guest as "Luke Kuechly, Panthers Linebacker." The scene transitions to a wider shot of the studio, revealing multiple guests seated around the host, each with their own microphones and laptops. The studio is decorated with sports-themed items, such as helmets and a "Traeger" sign, and the atmosphere is lively and engaging. The guests, including one in a purple jersey, are actively participating in the discussion, contributing to the dynamic and interactive nature of the show. The video captures the essence of a sports talk show, with a focus on the host and guest interaction, set against the backdrop of a bustling city.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker discussing "inflated tackle production", pointing out that many tackles happened close to the line of scrimmage. He attributes this sentiment to his dad, who believed a large number of tackles consisted of "jumping on the pile." Another male speaker interjects with "wow", seemingly in response. A ding is heard as the clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape. Two men are seated, one wearing a purple jersey with the number 15 and headphones, and the other in a black jacket with a logo, holding a piece of paper. The studio is adorned with sports memorabilia, including helmets, footballs, and a laptop. The man in the black jacket speaks into a microphone, while the man in the purple jersey listens attentively. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing the man in the black jacket on the left and a football player in a white and red uniform on the right, with the text "The Dan Patrick Show Minnesota" displayed. The video then shifts to a wider shot of the studio, revealing multiple people engaged in conversation, with laptops and papers on the tables. The atmosphere is lively and focused on sports discussion, with the cityscape providing a dynamic backdrop. The video concludes with a close-up of the man in the black jacket, emphasizing his engagement in the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing football, noting someone "doesn't get up in a line of scrimmage," and stating that NFL guards and tight ends would dominate him, but he has good defensive tackles. He mentions names like Star and Kyle, adding that without them it might be a different situation. He continues to read, talking about an overall lack of speed and flexibility. There is a pause, and he mentions his dad's advice to stretch. The speaker reads more negative evaluations, expressing some frustration with the content and then quips, "How the hell did you make it in the NFL?" He reads more critiques about strength and softness, jokingly commenting he might as well quit. The speaker expresses humility and addresses others, counting them to identify who wrote the evaluations. There is mention of a cameraman and someone whose dad was sick, indicating a collaborative atmosphere with multiple men present.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man is seated in a studio setting, wearing a black jacket and a watch on his left wrist. He is holding a piece of paper and appears to be speaking into a microphone. The background features a window with a view of a cityscape, and on the table beside him, there are various sports memorabilia, including footballs, helmets, and a figurine. The text on the screen identifies him as "Luke Kuechly," the "#9 Overall Pick in 2012 NFL Draft (Boston College)." The atmosphere is professional, and the man seems to be engaged in a discussion or interview related to sports, specifically football. The setting suggests a sports talk show or interview segment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker asking how tough the other speaker's dad was. The other male speaker responds, his tone positive, saying his dad was "great" and "very supportive". He then recounts a story about wrestling, and his dad's insistence that he "finish it" if he started it. The clip concludes with indiscernible speech.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape. Two men are seated, one behind a desk cluttered with memorabilia and the other in a leather armchair. The man in the armchair, dressed in a light blue shirt and dark pants, holds a piece of paper and speaks into a microphone, with a television screen displaying a football player in a green jersey with the number 8. The desk is adorned with various sports-related items, including helmets and figurines, and a sign reading "The Dan Patrick Show." The background includes a large screen with the NFL logo and a football graphic, along with the Mercedes-Benz Stadium logo. The atmosphere is professional and focused on sports discussion, with the man in the armchair appearing engaged in the conversation. The text overlay identifies the man as "Kirk Cousins, 4th Round Pick in 2012 NFL Draft (Michigan State)," providing context to his role in the discussion. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two men, emphasizing the sports-themed environment and the detailed setting of the studio.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker introducing a report about Kirk Cousins from when he was coming out of college. He then reads various critiques about his accuracy, inability to make "flash plays," need for supporting talent, lack of arm strength, inability to manipulate defensive backs, problems with pocket pressure causing poor throws, and final suggestion that he had late-round value for a backup role. He spoke in an objective, report-like tone. After he finishes reading, he asks what bothers the listener the most about the critiques.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape. Two men are seated, one behind a desk with a microphone and the other in a leather armchair, both engaged in a discussion. The man behind the desk wears headphones and speaks into a microphone, while the man in the armchair, dressed in a light blue shirt and dark pants, holds a piece of paper and a football, gesturing as he speaks. The desk is adorned with various sports memorabilia, including figurines, helmets, and a television screen displaying an image of a football player. The background features a large screen with the NFL logo and a football graphic, along with the text "Mercedes-Benz Stadium." The atmosphere is professional and focused on sports commentary, with the men actively participating in the conversation. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two hosts, emphasizing their engagement and the sports-themed environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing football, critically addressing evaluations of college quarterbacks and emphasizing the importance of winning games and playoff success. His tone is conversational but firm, laced with sarcasm when questioning overly specific analytical criteria. He transitioned into a reflective mood when discussing team performance and the need for significant improvement.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in a brown leather chair, holding a piece of paper and speaking into a microphone with a Mercedes-Benz logo. He is surrounded by football memorabilia, including helmets and figurines, and a small dog wearing a red jersey is visible on the table beside him. The background shows a large window with a view of a cityscape and a wooden table with a lamp. The scene transitions to a wider shot, revealing another man seated at a desk with a microphone, wearing a headset and glasses, and surrounded by various items such as a laptop, a football, and a television screen displaying the text "Dan Patrick's Atlanta." The setting appears to be a studio with a sports theme, featuring logos and decorations related to the NFL and the Mercedes-Benz Stadium. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text "THE PATRIOTS" in bold white letters, indicating a possible reference to the New England Patriots football team.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker, expressing determination, saying, "That's going to, that knock is going to be there until you go out there and win and win and win." His tone is assertive and motivated as he emphasizes winning. He acknowledges the team aspect but confirms he's still pursuing something. Another male speaker interjects, advising the first not to get too fired up, his tone calm and slightly amused. Next, the sound of speech is heard, immediately followed by the sound of someone drinking liquid.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a sports talk show set in a studio with a large window showcasing a cityscape. Two men are engaged in a conversation, with one seated behind a desk adorned with sports memorabilia, including helmets, a football, and a microphone. The other man, dressed in a blue shirt and white sneakers, sits in a chair holding a piece of paper, likely discussing sports-related topics. The desk prominently displays a sign reading "The Dan Patrick Show," indicating the show's name. The atmosphere is casual and focused on sports, with the men actively participating in the discussion, gesturing and speaking into the microphone. The background includes posters and a parrot statue, adding to the studio's decor. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the hosts, emphasizing their engagement in the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing his height for an NFL quarterback, acknowledging it as below average, but also mentioning that he is still growing, referring to measurements at the combine and pro day. The other male speaker expresses surprise and congratulates him on the height gain. Then the first speaker sarcastically addresses criticism that he benefited from a scheme that allowed for an abundance of one-on-ones, joking that some people would rather play in a bad scheme with a crappy coach, sarcastically suggesting that it would be good for him. Finally, he mentions open.

events_list.video_caption: In a cozy studio setting, a man with long hair and a beard, dressed in a blue t-shirt and black shorts, sits comfortably in a white armchair, holding a piece of paper and speaking into a microphone. The room is decorated with sports memorabilia, including a football helmet, a football, and a red can, all placed on a wooden desk. A large window in the background offers a view of a cityscape, while a television screen displays an image of a football player in action. Another man, wearing a white shirt and headphones, is seated at a desk with a laptop, listening attentively. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed, with the two men engaged in a conversation, likely discussing sports-related topics. The man in the armchair gestures with his hand as he speaks, emphasizing his points, while the other man remains focused on the conversation. The room is well-lit, with natural light streaming in from the window, creating a warm and inviting environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker discussing football, reflecting on a game, and then analyzing player characteristics. The tone is conversational and analytical. He references arm strength, running ability, and throwing mechanics. Then, the speech is interrupted by background noise, seemingly a car alarm, leading to someone angrily telling the alarm to stop. After the interruption, a transition occurs with the speaker remarking about the rude disturbance and trying to resume the conversation.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens in a brightly lit studio with large windows showcasing a cityscape. Two men are engaged in a conversation, with one seated behind a desk cluttered with sports memorabilia, including helmets and a football, while the other sits in a chair holding papers. The man in the chair, dressed in a blue t-shirt and shorts, speaks into a microphone, gesturing with his hands. The desk features a large image of a football player, and the room is decorated with sports-themed items and a colorful rug. The scene transitions to a purple screen with the text "DON'T FORGET TO Subscribe" and "HIGHLIGHT HEAVEN," encouraging viewers to subscribe to the channel. The video concludes with a black screen, indicating the end of the segment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing football scouts' concerns about arm strength, quoting Mike Leach and mentioning a prospect grade, focusing on its implications. His tone is conversational and analytical. Light, instrumental hip-hop music plays subtly in the background, creating a relaxed mood. The speaker acknowledges his own attributes, reacting with humor and confidence when scouts do not give accurate feedback.
